results.question: List all employees in the Sales department
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, e.email, e.phone, e.hire_date FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id WHERE d.name = 'Sales' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many employees were hired in 2024?
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: What is the average salary by department?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, AVG(es.amount) AS average_salary FROM departments d JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.department_id JOIN employee_salaries es ON e.employee_id = es.employee_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all customers with credit limit over $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT customer_id, name, credit_limit FROM customers WHERE credit_limit > 100000;

results.question: How many sales orders are in pending status?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(order_id) FROM sales_orders WHERE status = 'pending' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all products in the Electronics category
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.sku, p.name, p.description, p.unit_cost, p.list_price, p.weight FROM products p JOIN product_categories pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id WHERE pc.name = 'Electronics' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the names of all warehouses?
results.sql_generated: SELECT name FROM warehouses LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all active vendors
results.sql_generated: SELECT vendor_id, vendor_number, name, email, phone, website, address_id, payment_terms, currency_id, tax_id, is_active, created_at FROM vendors WHERE is_active = true LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different account types in the chart of accounts?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM account_types LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all bank accounts and their current balances
results.sql_generated: SELECT ba.account_number, ba.account_name, ba.current_balance FROM bank_accounts ba LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many projects are currently active?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM projects WHERE status = 'active' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT asset_id, asset_tag, name, description, category_id, location_id, assigned_to, purchase_date, purchase_cost, vendor_id, po_id, serial_number, warranty_expiry, status, disposal_date, disposal_amount, created_at FROM fixed_assets LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are all the available leave types?
results.sql_generated: SELECT name FROM leave_types LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all training courses that are mandatory
results.sql_generated: SELECT name, description, duration_hours, cost FROM training_courses WHERE is_mandatory = true LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different opportunity stages?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM opportunity_stages LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all countries in the system
results.sql_generated: SELECT name FROM countries LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many departments are there?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(department_id) AS total_departments FROM departments LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all units of measure
results.sql_generated: SELECT name, abbreviation FROM units_of_measure LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What fiscal years exist in the system?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT year FROM fiscal_years LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different asset categories?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM asset_categories LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees who have been with the company for more than 5 years and earn above $100,000
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: operator does not exist: integer > interval

results.question: List employees and their managers' names
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_number AS employee, m.first_name || ' ' || m.last_name AS manager FROM employees e JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which employees have pending leave requests?
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employees e JOIN leave_requests lr ON e.employee_id = lr.employee_id WHERE lr.status = 'Pending' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the number of employees per position title
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.title, COUNT(e.employee_id) AS employee_count FROM positions p JOIN employees e ON p.position_id = e.position_id GROUP BY p.title LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees with expiring certifications in the next 6 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, c.name AS certification_name, ec.expiry_date FROM employees e JOIN employee_certifications ec ON e.employee_id = ec.employee_id JOIN certifications c ON ec.certification_id = c.certification_id WHERE ec.expiry_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '6 months' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total sales amount by customer for 2024?
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    c.customer_id, 
    c.name, 
    SUM(so.total) AS total_sales_amount
FROM 
    sales_orders so
JOIN 
    customers c ON so.customer_id = c.customer_id
WHERE 
    EXTRACT(YEAR FROM so.order_date) = 2024
GROUP BY 
    c.customer_id, 
    c.name;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: List the top 10 customers by total order value
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id, c.name, SUM(ol.line_total) AS total_order_value FROM sales_orders so JOIN order_lines ol ON so.order_id = ol.order_id JOIN customers c ON so.customer_id = c.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_id, c.name ORDER BY total_order_value DESC LIMIT 10;

results.question: Show sales opportunities in the Negotiation stage worth over $50,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT so.opportunity_id, so.name, so.amount, os.name AS stage_name FROM sales_opportunities so JOIN opportunity_stages os ON so.stage_id = os.stage_id WHERE os.name = 'Negotiation' AND so.amount > 50000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the conversion rate from quotes to orders?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT q.quote_id) AS total_quotes, COUNT(DISTINCT o.order_id) AS total_orders, (COUNT(DISTINCT o.order_id) * 1.0 / COUNT(DISTINCT q.quote_id)) AS conversion_rate FROM sales_quotes q LEFT JOIN sales_orders o ON q.quote_id = o.quote_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List sales orders by sales representative with their totals
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    s.sales_rep_id,
    e.name AS sales_rep_name,
    SUM(s.subtotal) AS total_subtotal,
    SUM(s.tax_amount) AS total_tax_amount,
    SUM(s.shipping_cost) AS total_shipping_cost,
    SUM(s.total) AS total_amount
FROM 
    sales_orders s
JOIN 
    employees e ON s.sales_rep_id = e.employee_id
GROUP BY 
    s.sales_rep_id, e.name;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Which products have inventory below their reorder point?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name, rl.reorder_quantity, il.quantity_on_hand FROM products p JOIN reorder_rules rl ON p.product_id = rl.product_id JOIN inventory_levels il ON p.product_id = il.product_id AND rl.warehouse_id = il.warehouse_id WHERE il.quantity_on_hand < rl.reorder_quantity LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show total inventory value by warehouse
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    w.warehouse_id,
    w.name AS warehouse_name,
    SUM(il.quantity_on_hand * p.price) AS total_inventory_value
FROM 
    warehouses w
JOIN 
    inventory_levels il ON w.warehouse_id = il.warehouse_id
JOIN 
    products p ON il.product_id = p.product_id
GROUP BY 
    w.warehouse_id, w.name;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: List products that had stock transfers in the last 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name FROM products p JOIN transfer_lines tl ON p.product_id = tl.product_id JOIN stock_transfers st ON tl.transfer_id = st.transfer_id WHERE st.transfer_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total spend by vendor this year?
results.sql_generated:
SELECT SUM(vi.total) AS total_spend
FROM vendor_invoices vi
JOIN purchase_orders po ON vi.po_id = po.po_id
JOIN vendors v ON vi.vendor_id = v.vendor_id
WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM vi.invoice_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE);
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: List purchase orders that are overdue (expected date passed but not received)
results.sql_generated: SELECT po.po_id, po.po_number, po.expected_date, gr.receipt_date FROM purchase_orders po LEFT JOIN goods_receipts gr ON po.po_id = gr.po_id AND gr.receipt_date IS NULL WHERE po.expected_date < CURRENT_DATE LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the approval rate for purchase requisitions
results.sql_generated: SELECT (COUNT(CASE WHEN status = 'approved' THEN 1 ELSE NULL END) / COUNT(requisition_id)) * 100 AS approval_rate FROM purchase_requisitions LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total debit and credit for each account in the current period?
results.sql_generated: SELECT ba.gl_account_id AS account_id, SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'Debit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_debit, SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'Credit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_credit FROM bank_transactions bt JOIN bank_accounts ba ON bt.bank_account_id = ba.bank_account_id WHERE bt.transaction_date BETWEEN (SELECT start_date FROM fiscal_periods WHERE is_closed = false LIMIT 1) AND (SELECT end_date FROM fiscal_periods WHERE is_closed = false LIMIT 1) GROUP BY ba.gl_account_id;

results.question: List all posted journal entries for the current month
results.sql_generated: SELECT je.entry_id, je.entry_number, je.entry_date, je.description, je.reference, je.posted_by, je.status, je.created_at FROM journal_entries je WHERE je.entry_date >= CURRENT_DATE AND je.entry_date < DATE_TRUNC('month', CURRENT_DATE) + INTERVAL '1 month' AND je.status = 'Posted' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show budget vs actual spending by department
results.sql_generated:
SELECT d.name AS department_name, SUM(pb.planned_amount) AS total_planned_budget, SUM(be.amount) AS total_actual_spending 
FROM departments d 
JOIN budgets b ON d.department_id = b.department_id 
LEFT JOIN project_budgets pb ON b.budget_id = pb.budget_id 
LEFT JOIN project_expenses be ON pb.project_id = be.project_id 
GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total expense amount per project?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_id, p.name, SUM(e.amount) AS total_expense_amount FROM projects p JOIN project_expenses e ON p.project_id = e.project_id GROUP BY p.project_id, p.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List projects that are over budget
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_id, p.name, p.budget AS planned_budget, SUM(pe.amount) AS actual_expenses FROM projects p JOIN project_expenses pe ON p.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY p.project_id, p.name, p.budget HAVING SUM(pe.amount) > p.budget LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show project resources and their allocation percentages
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_number, r.employee_id, r.role, r.allocation_percent FROM projects p JOIN project_resources r ON p.project_id = r.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List fixed assets by category with their total purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT ac.name AS category_name, SUM(fa.purchase_cost) AS total_purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN asset_categories ac ON fa.category_id = ac.category_id GROUP BY ac.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List assets due for maintenance in the next 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.asset_id, fa.asset_tag, fa.name, mt.name AS maintenance_type, am.scheduled_date FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN asset_maintenance am ON fa.asset_id = am.asset_id JOIN maintenance_types mt ON am.maintenance_type_id = mt.type_id WHERE am.scheduled_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days' ORDER BY am.scheduled_date LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many documents are attached to each entity type?
results.sql_generated: SELECT entity_type, COUNT(*) AS document_count FROM document_attachments GROUP BY entity_type LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate employee turnover rate by department for 2024
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, COUNT(CASE WHEN e.termination_date BETWEEN '2023-12-31' AND '2024-12-31' THEN 1 END) / COUNT(e.employee_id) AS turnover_rate FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id WHERE e.termination_date BETWEEN '2023-12-31' AND '2024-12-31' GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find the salary percentile ranking for each employee within their department
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, d.department_id, d.name AS department_name, es.amount AS salary, PERCENT_RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY e.department_id ORDER BY es.amount) AS salary_percentile_rank FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id JOIN employee_salaries es ON e.employee_id = es.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify employees who have not completed mandatory training
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employee_training et ON e.employee_id = et.employee_id AND et.course_id IN (SELECT course_id FROM training_courses WHERE is_mandatory) WHERE et.training_id IS NULL LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate month-over-month sales growth rate for the past 12 months
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    EXTRACT(MONTH FROM so.order_date) AS month,
    EXTRACT(YEAR FROM so.order_date) AS year,
    SUM(so.total) AS total_sales,
    LAG(SUM(so.total)) OVER (ORDER BY EXTRACT(YEAR FROM so.order_date), EXTRACT(MONTH FROM so.order_date)) AS previous_month_sales
FROM 
    sales_orders so
WHERE 
    so.order_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '12 months'
GROUP BY 
    month, year
ORDER BY 
    year, month;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Find the average order value and order frequency for each customer segment based on credit limit
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.credit_limit, AVG(s.total) AS avg_order_value, COUNT(s.order_id) AS order_frequency FROM sales_orders s JOIN customers c ON s.customer_id = c.customer_id GROUP BY c.credit_limit;

results.question: What is the sales pipeline weighted value by stage and expected close month?
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    os.stage_id,
    os.expected_close_date::date_trunc('month', expected_close_date) AS expected_month,
    SUM(os.amount * os.probability / 100) AS weighted_value
FROM 
    sales_opportunities os
JOIN 
    opportunity_stages ostage ON os.stage_id = ostage.stage_id
GROUP BY 
    os.stage_id, expected_month LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 2 attempts: type "date_trunc" does not exist

results.question: Calculate inventory turnover ratio by product category
results.sql_generated: SELECT pc.name AS category_name, SUM(il.quantity_on_hand) / COUNT(it.transaction_id) AS inventory_turnover_ratio FROM products p JOIN product_categories pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id JOIN inventory_levels il ON p.product_id = il.product_id JOIN inventory_transactions it ON il.level_id = it.location_id GROUP BY pc.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify products with significant inventory discrepancies (adjustment > 10% of stock)
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name, SUM(al.quantity_change) AS total_adjustment, il.quantity_on_hand AS current_stock FROM products p JOIN inventory_levels il ON p.product_id = il.product_id LEFT JOIN adjustment_lines al ON p.product_id = al.product_id AND il.warehouse_id = al.location_id GROUP BY p.product_id, p.name, il.quantity_on_hand HAVING ABS(SUM(al.quantity_change) / il.quantity_on_hand) > 0.1 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate vendor performance score based on on-time delivery and invoice accuracy
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_id, v.name AS vendor_name, AVG(CASE WHEN oi.invoice_date <= po.expected_date THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS on_time_delivery_score, AVG(CASE WHEN oi.amount_paid = oi.total THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS invoice_accuracy_score FROM vendors v JOIN purchase_orders po ON v.vendor_id = po.vendor_id JOIN vendor_invoices oi ON po.po_id = oi.po_id GROUP BY v.vendor_id, v.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Generate a trial balance for the current period showing debits and credits by account category
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    at.category,
    SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'Debit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS debits,
    SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'Credit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS credits
FROM 
    bank_transactions bt
JOIN 
    account_types at ON bt.gl_account_id = at.type_id
WHERE 
    bt.transaction_date BETWEEN (SELECT start_date FROM fiscal_periods WHERE is_current_period) AND (SELECT end_date FROM fiscal_periods WHERE is_current_period)
GROUP BY 
    at.category;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate cash flow from bank transactions grouped by transaction type and month
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    transaction_type,
    DATE_TRUNC('month', transaction_date) AS month,
    SUM(amount) AS cash_flow
FROM 
    bank_transactions
GROUP BY 
    transaction_type, 
    month LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate project profitability comparing budget vs actual expenses
results.sql_generated:
SELECT 
    p.project_id,
    pb.planned_amount,
    SUM(pe.amount) AS actual_expenses,
    (pb.planned_amount - SUM(pe.amount)) AS profitability
FROM 
    project_budgets pb
JOIN 
    projects p ON pb.project_id = p.project_id
LEFT JOIN 
    project_expenses pe ON p.project_id = pe.project_id
GROUP BY 
    p.project_id, pb.planned_amount;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Find resource allocation by employee across all active projects
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, p.project_id, p.name AS project_name, pr.role, pr.allocation_percent, pr.start_date, pr.end_date FROM employees e JOIN project_resources pr ON e.employee_id = pr.employee_id JOIN projects p ON pr.project_id = p.project_id WHERE e.is_active = true LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their assigned employees and current locations
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.asset_id, fa.asset_tag, fa.name, fa.description, fa.category_id, fa.location_id, fa.assigned_to, fa.purchase_date, fa.purchase_cost, fa.vendor_id, fa.po_id, fa.serial_number, fa.warranty_expiry, fa.status, fa.disposal_date, fa.disposal_amount, fa.created_at, e.first_name AS assigned_first_name, e.last_name AS assigned_last_name, el.name AS current_location FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN employees e ON fa.assigned_to = e.employee_id JOIN asset_locations el ON fa.location_id = el.location_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Create a comprehensive employee cost report including salary and benefits by department
results.sql_generated:
SELECT d.name AS department_name, SUM(e.salary) AS total_salary, SUM(es.amount) AS total_benefits 
FROM departments d 
JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.department_id 
LEFT JOIN employee_salaries es ON e.employee_id = es.employee_id AND es.end_date IS NULL 
LEFT JOIN employee_benefits eb ON e.employee_id = eb.employee_id 
LEFT JOIN budgets b ON d.department_id = b.department_id 
GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;
